page.title: 13Attitudes in Northill
page.content: Many residents are very concerned with conserving the appearance of the area. Recent examples of infilling have been considered undesirable both in size & appearance. Anxiety is felt over the lack of{houses}for first time buyers & provision of suitable accommodation for the elderly. Concern is shown for {preservation of hedgerows, footpaths & {trees}in the surrounding countryside. Legislation to control{stubble burning has been appreciated. Signs of{urban- {isation}have been deplored, e.g. brick walls replacing front garden hedges; high kerbing installed without local consultation in spite of the{1974 Con- {servation Report}which commended the previous bullnosed pavements. Absence of{street lighting}continues by public choice. Loss of{Post Office, shop and {resident policeman}are regretted as is the proposed closure of{Park Hospital.
